There are still several measures that can be put in place to strengthen the integrity of microfilm records and catch any attempts at manipulation, even by a corrupt official who is skilled at covering their tracks. Here are a few examples:

1. Periodic audits by independent entities: Apart from internal audits, it is also recommended that external parties or independent auditors conduct periodic reviews of microfilm records. This can help identify any discrepancies or red flags that may have been overlooked by insiders.

2. Random checks: The city or regulatory body can randomly select and check a few microfilm records from time to time to ensure that they have not been tampered with. This can act as a deterrent and alert any potential wrongdoers that their activities may be caught.

3. Digitization: To further strengthen the integrity of microfilm records, many cities are moving towards digitizing their records. Digitization can help identify unauthorized access or changes to the records through the use of secure digital signatures or blockchain technology.

4. Whistleblower protections and hotlines: It's possible that someone who is aware of any wrongdoing may come forward and report it. Whistleblower protections and hotlines operated by regulatory agencies can encourage whistleblowers to speak up without fear of retaliation.

In conclusion, while no system is perfect, implementing multiple safeguards, such as audits by independent parties, random checks, digitization, and whistleblower protections, can help to increase the integrity of microfilm records and detect any potential manipulations by those who are trying to cheat the system.
